answers.answer: Yess n we still have a lil bit of heat left before.winter hits. Its worse wen ur cold. My backs hurts like hell n I get horrible migrains. If I cud.go back n go natural I wud. With this pregnancy im go natural
That never happened to me. It sounds painful tho. In surprised i havent had no back pain cus the guy that did mine messed up and had to do it twice. I hope u feel better try some heat pads

It's awful when it happens. If im taking a little walk when it happens, I automatically need to stop and rest for a minute. I also had a csection so that's still painful. And not walking around isn't an option. Apparently, I'm high risk for PPD because of my family history and walking a little bit outside when one of the orders I got from the doctor. He doesn't want me staying inside for any length of time. Like I said though, the guy did a great.job (and was super nice. Visited my bf and I multiple times during our stay just to talk about things..mainly football haha) I hope the cramping goes away..I hate when. It happens when I'm carrying my son. :/

I had an epidural with my daughter she 8 months and I'm expecting a little boy I'm 6months I will be going natural this time around didn't like the epidural at all no no no no no no. My back does hurt especially when cold .
Mine hurt for a week or two and then went away! But that is one of the side effects you could get from an epidural. It can cause permanent back pain.

Yes mine hurt so bad that I couldn't enjoy carrying my little boy around. It hurt for a while too. My cousins wife complained of back pain as well. I don't want to be induced again and I don't want an epidural. I didn't want it in the first place but preeclampsia raised my blood pressure too high. I'm hoping for a water birth this time around. I heard it is so much easier and has a higher chance of no pain relievers because it is so relaxing. I hope your pain passes quickly and if it continues to bother you speak with your doctor.

question: I know this is a pregnant forum but I don't have anyone else to ask, and you ladies have wetr helpful throughout my whole pregnancy. When you had the epidural, did your back cramp up after? I had my son just over a week ago and I ended up getting an epidural. The pitocin made me dilate to fast so my body wasn't taking kindly to the contractions. Now that it's a week later Im getting a really bad cramp off and on in my lower back. I was wondering if anyone else had this happen? The guy who did the epidural did a great job, I didn't even feel the needle or anything. And the cramp just started a few days ago..any one have this experience?
title: Question for already Mommy's.
